content: materials gauge lux adorna knits 100% cashmere fun size bundle in sport 20 sts = 4 in st st 80 g/2 8oz 360 yd/329m 1 bundle of 8 colors us size 5 3 75 mm set of dpn s or circular needles for working in the notions stitch marker round or size needed to obtain gauge scrap yarn for provisional co difficulty intermediate spare needle for working in the round lila cowl the lila cowl is a worked in the round in a chevron pattern it is the perfect size cowl to keep you warm and toasty while adding a pop of color to highlight your face pattern notes there are 2 versions for this chevron striped cowl 1 the lila cowl by pepperberry knits written here is an intermediate pattern with increase that are worked using left and right lifted increase 2 the lila cowl by lux adorna on the next page is written for an advanced beginner skill level the increases are worked using yo s both make a beautiful chevron cowl the difference is skill and look the left and right lifted increase on this pattern create increases that lean in the proper direction for a more polished look the yo increase on the pattern on the next page is an easier skill yet also creates a lovely chevron pick whichever skill level you are comfortable with the lila cowl is worked in the round choose whichever method of knitting in the round that is comfortable to you use scrap yarn for the provisional co there is no need to weave in ends when you change colors for the stripes to change colors cut the working yarn leaving a 2 tail using a square knot tie the new yarn color to the tail snugly behind your last worked st you will work every color twice check your gauge you run the risk of not having enough yarn to do the second set of stripes if your gauge is off stitches s2kp - slip 2 stitches knitwise at the same time k1 pass the 2 slipped sts over lli pu and knit into the stitch 2 row below the just worked st on your rh needle rli pu and knit into the stitch one row below the first stitch on your lh needle pattern using scrap yarn provisional co 84 sts using main yarn k one round as a set up round join in round being careful not to twist stitches pm round 1 sm k to end or round round 2 sm k1 lli k4 s2kp k5 rli k1 repeat to end 14 st repeat repeat rnds 1 and 2 5 times more break yarn and tie on a new color follow instructions given in the pattern notes above cont as est working 12 rnds per color using every color twice leave a long yarn tail to work kitchener st finishing place provisional sts onto a new needle kitchener st these co sts to the live sts
